Next to the Casa Batlló lies several other adventurous buildings which comprise the Mansana de Discórdia... one of Barcelona's most eclectic building blocks.

The back of the famous facade of the Casa Batlló... a mosaic masterpiece with a set of 8 chimnies grouped together to looke like an artistic sculpture.

The design along the top ridge of the facade line on the Casa Batlló is similar to a dragon's back.. or how our imagination has come to believe one is

Ok shameless self promotion but... I've been published!! Yeeeaay!! :-) Everywhere Magazine published two of my photos in it's final edition. $200 for two photos... and that went straight to <a href"http:www.kiva.com">www.kiva.com<a> where 8 people seeking loans were helped out by their contribution. So thank you Everywhere magazine for highlighting my work and sorry that you stopped publication. On this page the photo below of the Casa Batlló was used in a story on Barcelona.
The first floor of the Manzana de la Discordia with huge oddly designed picture windows overlookin the Passeig de Gracia.
barcelona españa spain mediterranean espana espagne casabatllo cataluña casabatlló española mediterranio batlló manzanadeladiscordia probinziadebarzelona

Gaudi's imagination at work. Lots of colour, rounded edges and despite the almost cartoonish appearance there were all sorts of unique technical innovations in the interior design of the building.. natural light made it's way to even the deepest of rooms, a unique natural air ventilation system designed into the doors and windows etc.. Considering it was built at the turn of the 20th century much of it paved the way for ideas and concepts of the 21st century. ..and still today for the most part we live and work in boring retangular boxes
barcelona españa spain mediterranean espana espagne casabatllo cataluña casabatlló española mediterranio batlló manzanadeladiscordia probinziadebarzelona
